channel.title: Artifacts Reference on API Mocking and Testing | Microcks.io
channel.description: Recent content in Artifacts Reference on API Mocking and Testing | Microcks.io

item.title: OpenAPI Conventions
item.description: Conventions In addition of schema information, Microcks uses OpenAPI Example Objects to produce working mocks and build test suite for validating your implementation.

item.title: AsyncAPI Conventions
item.description: Conventions In addition of schema information, Microcks uses AsyncAPI Message Example Objects to produce example messages for mocking purpose.

item.title: Swagger Conventions
item.description: Microcks is supporting Swagger mocking and testing thanks to multi-artifacts support feature.

item.title: GraphQL Conventions
item.description: In order to use GraphQL in Microcks, you will need two artifacts for each API definition as explained in Multi-artifacts support :

item.title: gRPC Conventions
item.description: In order to use gRPC in Microcks, you will need two artifacts for each service definition as explained in Multi-artifacts support :

item.title: Postman Conventions
item.description: Conventions In order to be correctly imported and understood by Microcks, your Postman collection should follow a little set of reasonable conventions and best practices.

item.title: SoapUI Conventions
item.description: Conventions In order to be correctly imported and understood by Microcks, your SoapUI project should follow a little set of reasonable conventions and best practices.

item.title: Http Archive Conventions
item.description: Conventions In order to be correctly imported and understood by Microcks, your HAR file should follow a little set of reasonable conventions and best practices.
